H0.text: Iron is the material attracted to a magnet.

H1.text: Wood is not attracted to a magnet.

H2.text: Plastic is the material attracted to a magnet.

H3.text: Ice is a material that is attracted to a magnet.

A4.text: Only a few substances are ferromagnetic; the most common ones are iron, cobalt, nickel, and their alloys.

A5.text: The force of a magnet on paramagnetic, diamagnetic, and antiferromagnetic materials is usually too weak to be felt and can be detected only by laboratory instruments
